intro: Barbacenia rectifolia, commonly known as the straight-leaved barbacenia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. Barbacenia rectifolia thrives in warm, humid climates and is often cultivated for its ornamental value. It prefers well-drained soil and full sunlight for optimal growth.
